moves.1. a4 e5: Same players, different colors. Interesting opening by my opponent, but I stick with my favored tactic.
moves.6. Nxf2 Qxg5: Probably not the best result, but I'm still up on material. Sadly my development is rather lacking.
moves.7. Qd2 Qf5 8. Qb4: Oh boy. I have GOT to get my knights out ASAP.
moves.8... Nc6 9. Qc5 Nd4 10. Qxc7 Nxc2+: After some dancing around between knight and queen, I think I have a wonderful fork here...
moves.11... Nf6 12. Qxc8+: ...Don't look at me. I don't even know. That bishop was worthless at that point.
moves.12... Rxc8: If you watched my previous game, you'll note that hilariously, not only was he first put in check the same way on the same turn in both games, he also lost his queen on the same turn in both games. Go figure.
The beginning of the end starts here.
moves.17. Rb1 Qf4 18. e3 Qxe3+ 19. Kd1 Nf2+: At this point he's boned, but he doesn't realize it as post-game discussion proved.
moves.20... Qd2#:
Bam.


One thing that bothered me is how he never developed his h1 rook. it was open almost from the beginning but he never once took advantage of it. He likely could've turned the game around if he had.
